In an effort to be as transparent as possible about the decision to go remote, we wanted to share that the new developments have to do with a very recent loss of several staff members due to their and their family's health concerns. We didn’t want staff with health concerns to feel that they had to choose between their job and their health. Our staff is what makes us special, and it’s that awesome staff that allows us to be the only school offering its own curriculum. If we forced staff to choose between their job and their health, one could understand many choosing their health.

It was the decision that maintaining our current staff, who know our students, was the best way to provide instruction as we start the school year.

We know this is difficult. Thank you for your understanding.

Shannon Brunink
Head of School

1 cup all-purpose flour
1 cup water

1/3 cup salt
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
food coloring (tip: add the food coloring to the cup of water for easier mixing)

Instructions

Mix together all the ingredients in a 2-quart saucepan.
Cook over low/medium heat, stirring. OK if it's lumpy!
Continue stirring until the mixture is thickened and begins to gather around the spoon.

A Note from Mr. Shannon Brunink, Head of School

Hello BR families,

We wanted to take a moment to officially introduce Officer Nicole Hamberg from the Holland Police Department. Nicole is a Black River parent and also works with the school however she can. While she is not employed by Black River, we are so happy to know that Officer Hamberg has more flexibility in her schedule to spend more time with us here. Because of this, she is making a point to be on campus as much as she can when kids are dropped off and picked up, both to offer any assistance she can but more to show our kids how positive police can be in our everyday life.

Besides drop off and pick up times, Officer Hamberg will likely spend time with our students reading to elementary classes and also offering her expertise during our CAP classes to our older kids.

We have known Nicole for a long time and we are excited that she can spend even more time here at Black River!
